page.title: 05Bryanston Village
page.content: {Lower Bryanston}originally provided estate workers' housing. Around the village green are the Home Farm, its outbuildings, the Old Forge, the Post Office(formerly a telegraph office), the Estate Club which used to be the laundry for the House & the Crown Agents' maintenance yard. On{The Cliff}is the council estate, built after 1945, & more housing from the Portman era.In 1985,3 luxury homes were built on land sold by the School; one only has been bought so far. Most of the houses are slate roofed & built of engineering brick. On the New Road near the Home Farm dairy & around the School are several single storey wooden houses. {The Crown Agents}rent out most of the estate houses as well as the land. The council housing is mainly let but some houses have been bought recently.
